title: product videos on Amazon
content: I been using Amazon for a number of years. Until a couple of weeks ago the product videos yielded a message "video not supported by this browser". I liked that because I use the internet selectively - I have a filter that provides me with a "white list" of sites I wish to access, and unless I make a special request, I cannot access other sites. Similarly I try to avoid most videos. Recently the Amazon product videos have been accessible. Is there some way Firefox can once again "not support" them? Thank you very much.

title: Delete cookies on close not saving
content:
I recently re-imaged my computer and reinstalled Firefox and I'm getting an issue where the "Delete cookies and site data when Firefox is closed" setting under Privacy & Security keeps getting re-checked after I close and re-open my browser. This is causing issues with logins being saved for me. At first I found this article,

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350469

but it looks like this doesn't apply to me as I don't have any custom settings for my history. I then tried to follow all the steps in this article,

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-to-fix-preferences-wont-save

and sadly nothing here worked either. I have even reinstalled Firefox just to be sure and I'm still having no luck. Personally I just ignored it for a while but I've now seen other users have the same issue (I work at an IT desk and I can confirm 2 others that have seen this same issue). Just to confirm I have no browser extensions installed and I have the latest Firefox updates. Any help would be greatly appreciated as I'm a bit too stubborn to switch over to using Chrome but it looks like I might have to if this keeps happening.
creator: bhurley924

title: Link works in Chrome and Edge NOT Firefox

title: How can I clear a container data in firefox
content:
Let me say it aloud. I love the multi-container support from Firefox and is really helpful in maintaining privacy.

However, the more I use this feature I see something missing from it (Or maybe already existing feature,but I am not sure). I am not sure if Firefox has a feature, where I can clear cookies only for that container. So, for example, I have a Banking container and once I have completed my Banking transaction, I want to clear the container data. currently, I am using private session for it, but I want to retain banking data for a few days, that forces me to keep the private session open for a few days.

So, not sure if there is a feature in firefox to clear cookies/ pwds only for a specific container and not for all other containers.

title: Page not loading for 10-20 seconds, then it does after refresh
content:
Ever since installing firefox on a new pc, I've had the problem where I would click a link or enter a url, and sometimes (not always, about 20% of the time), the page will not load (there is a loading symbol but no page shows up), then it stops loading after about 10-20 seconds and there is no page (when I enter a url from a new tab, there is just a blank tab, when I click a link on a webpage, I just remain on the webpage), but when I re-enter the url or re-click the link, it does work. So happens for all links of the website I'm trying to visit.

To summarize: I click a link, and sometimes it loads for 10-20s and then just stops, and when I click again, it works.

Any help is appreciated!

title: creating desktop shortcuts via drag and drop
content:
My surface pro 7 with windows 10 or 11 will not create desktop shortcut from firefox (ver. 98.0.1 64 bit) using drag and drop with pen but will work using touch pad. I originally noticed this problem while running windows 11 on my surface pro 7. After doing some basic trouble shooting on my own I ended up re-imaging my surface pro 7 back to windows 10, I wasn't really thrilled with windows 11 anyway. At this point every thing worked normally. However, at some point firefox updated and the problem recurred. While using the touch pad is an acceptable work around when the keyboard is attached, using it as a tablet without the keyboard is a bit of an issue. Finger or pen is needed but won't work. thanks for your attention to this matter, it is appreciated. 

    Tom.

title: Firefox Android improperly zooming in cloud Outlook 365
content: I am using the cloud-based Outlook 365 app in Firefox Android. Every time I hit "New Message" to send an email, Firefox automatically zooms the page in, past the "Send Message" button. It seems to be auto-zooming to the "To:" line where the cursor flashes on this screen by default. When I type an email, the words are cut off, because the browser is zoomed into the text input area where I write the body of the email. When I try to un-zoom it, I can never get it to zoom all the way out properly again. When I exit the "New Message" screen to look at my inbox, it is still zoomed in and cutting text off. How do I fix this?
